SENT.plain: We report a case of Behçet's disease that presented as protracted fever of unknown origin
The diagnosis was established when a thromboembolic event and ora3l aphthous ulcers occurred simultaneously
Antibiotics had no effect on the fever, which resolved when glucocorticoid and anticoagulant therapy was given
Among causes of protracted fever of unknown origin, Behçet's disease is exceedingly rare but should be considered together with the other vasculitides
Above all, the presence of a fever should prompt a search for a thromboembolic complication
